title: Machine Learning and Sensory Training for Social Differences: Historical Comparative Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Computer Literacy and General Understanding of Science and Technology
context.additional_context: Learners engage in weekly 3×15-minute microlearning modules via mobile devices, cultivating critical thinking about the interaction between social contexts and technology

learning_goals: Learners can explain how racialized differences are reflected in the process of machine learning models interpreting data.
Learners can apply a framework to detect societal bias by comparing historical statistical data (e.g., 20th-century U.S. racial statistics) with modern machine learning cases.
Learners can identify cultural assumptions embedded in data classification systems through participatory observation and propose alternative approaches.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
